author: ben_a_adams
content:
Could all clients ensure in their Windows builds that their build tools are including an application manifest with  `<heapType>SegmentHeap</heapType>` in final exe because otherwise you'll get a terrible native allocator which; if it doesn't affect your runtime (for GC'd langs), will likely effect your db 

Docs: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/sbscs/application-manifests#heaptype

Example PR in Nethermind: https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/pull/7418/files

Is Windows specific; but the effect we were seeing was db access speed degrading over time and profiling showing it was all in allocator contention (which completely resolved with this one weird trick)
